20110127220721.000|20110127220723.000|TR0|ruled them with an iron hand for as long

20110127220725.000|20110127220728.000|TR0|

20110127220753.000|20110127220755.000|TR0|
20110127220755.000|20110127220757.000|TR0|I think, at this point, there's no sign of 
20110127220757.000|20110127220759.000|TR0|that, but I'm sure that we -- that's 
20110127220759.000|20110127220802.000|TR0|something we do need to be aware of.
20110127220802.000|20110127220804.000|TR0|
20110127220804.000|20110127220806.000|TR0|TODD:  Brian Fishman and other experts 
20110127220806.000|20110127220809.000|TR0|point to groups that have been banned by 
20110127220809.000|20110127220811.000|TR0|Mubarak's government, like the Muslim 
20110127220811.000|20110127220813.000|TR0|Brotherhood.  The Brotherhood lived by the 
20110127220813.000|20110127220815.000|TR0|gun long ago but in recent years, has 
20110127220815.000|20110127220818.000|TR0|become much more moderate, moved away from 
20110127220818.000|20110127220820.000|TR0|violence and toward providing social 
20110127220820.000|20110127220822.000|TR0|services through Islamic charities.
20110127220822.000|20110127220824.000|TR0|
20110127220824.000|20110127220827.000|TR0|Still, there are other Egyptian opposition 
20110127220827.000|20110127220829.000|TR0|figures who favor a more brutal approach.  
20110127220829.000|20110127220831.000|TR0|   MARC GINSBERG, FORMER U.S. AMBASSADOR 
20110127220831.000|20110127220834.000|TR0|TO MOROCCO:  Ayman Al- Zawahiri, the 
20110127220834.000|20110127220836.000|TR0|number two in Al Qaeda, was an Egyptian.  
20110127220836.000|20110127220838.000|TR0|He still has an enormous following in 
20110127220838.000|20110127220840.000|TR0|Egypt among very radical Islamic 
20110127220840.000|20110127220843.000|TR0|extremists.
20110127220843.000|20110127220845.000|TR0|
20110127220845.000|20110127220847.000|TR0|TODD:  Al-Zawahiri has been gunning for 
20110127220847.000|20110127220849.000|TR0|Mubarak for decades and experts say he may 
20110127220849.000|20110127220852.000|TR0|make a public statement during these 
20110127220852.000|20110127220854.000|TR0|protests.  But he's on the run and his old 
20110127220854.000|20110127220856.000|TR0|group, Egyptian Islamic Jihad, has been 
20110127220856.000|20110127220859.000|TR0|absorbed into Al Qaeda.
20110127220859.000|20110127220901.000|TR0|
20110127220901.000|20110127220903.000|TR0|Another faction, called The Islamic Group, 
20110127220903.000|20110127220905.000|TR0|has massacred tourists and once came close 
20110127220905.000|20110127220908.000|TR0|to assassinating Mubarak.  But experts say 
20110127220908.000|20110127220910.000|TR0|many of its members are now hiding out 
20110127220910.000|20110127220912.000|TR0|with Al Qaeda in Pakistan.  And its 
20110127220912.000|20110127220914.000|TR0|spiritual leader, Omar Abdel-Rahman, known 
20110127220914.000|20110127220917.000|TR0|as the blind sheikh, is serving a life 
20110127220917.000|20110127220919.000|TR0|sentence in the U.S. for his role in the 
20110127220919.000|20110127220921.000|TR0|1993 World Trade Center bombing.
20110127220921.000|20110127220924.000|TR0|

20110127220926.000|20110127220928.000|TR0|not necessarily out.
20110127220928.000|20110127220930.000|TR0|

20110127221007.000|20110127221009.000|TR0|TODD:  Then, says Brian Fishman, Al Qaeda 
20110127221009.000|20110127221011.000|TR0|and other militant groups might jump in 
20110127221011.000|20110127221014.000|TR0|and tell Egyptians that peaceful protests 
20110127221014.000|20110127221016.000|TR0|don't work and that violence is the only 
20110127221016.000|20110127221018.000|TR0|way to bring the change you want. That's 
20110127221018.000|20110127221020.000|TR0|why the absolutely crucial players in this 
20110127221020.000|20110127221023.000|TR0|whole scene right now are the Egyptian 
20110127221023.000|20110127221025.000|TR0|Army and security forces.  They're the 
20110127221025.000|20110127221027.000|TR0|ones who can decide whether this will be 
20110127221027.000|20110127221029.000|TR0|settled violently or peacefully. They're 
20110127221029.000|20110127221032.000|TR0|the ones, experts say, who are unlikely to 
20110127221032.000|20110127221034.000|TR0|let these militant groups rise to power -- 
20110127221034.000|20110127221036.000|TR0|Wolf.
20110127221036.000|20110127221039.000|TR0|

20110127221212.000|20110127221214.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN CONTRIBUTOR:  For those 
20110127221214.000|20110127221216.000|TR0|people who think the Tea Party is just a

20110127221219.000|20110127221221.000|TR0|reconsider.
20110127221221.000|20110127221223.000|TR0|
20110127221223.000|20110127221225.000|TR0|For starters, it seems like the Tea 
20110127221225.000|20110127221228.000|TR0|Partiers may be among the only people in 
20110127221228.000|20110127221230.000|TR0|Washington who are serious about reining 
20110127221230.000|20110127221232.000|TR0|in government spending.  While the 
20110127221232.000|20110127221235.000|TR0|Democrats and Republicans talk and talk 
20110127221235.000|20110127221237.000|TR0|and then they talk some more about cutting 
20110127221237.000|20110127221239.000|TR0|spending and reducing our skyrocketing 
20110127221239.000|20110127221241.000|TR0|deficits and $14 trillion national debt, 
20110127221241.000|20110127221244.000|TR0|some members of the Tea Party have come 
20110127221244.000|20110127221246.000|TR0|forward with solutions.
20110127221246.000|20110127221248.000|TR0|

20110127221250.000|20110127221253.000|TR0|Kentucky is proposing cutting $500 billion 
20110127221253.000|20110127221255.000|TR0|from federal spending in a single year.  
20110127221255.000|20110127221257.000|TR0|Now to be sure, he's got some drastic 
20110127221257.000|20110127221300.000|TR0|ideas here.  He wants to cut $42 billion 
20110127221300.000|20110127221302.000|TR0|from the food stamp program, $16 billion 
20110127221302.000|20110127221304.000|TR0|from the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.  
20110127221304.000|20110127221306.000|TR0|Also on Paul's cutting block, the 
20110127221306.000|20110127221309.000|TR0|Departments of Energy and Housing and 
20110127221309.000|20110127221311.000|TR0|Urban Development, most of the Department 
20110127221311.000|20110127221313.000|TR0|of Education, the Corporation for Public 
20110127221313.000|20110127221315.000|TR0|Broadcasting and the National Endowment 
20110127221315.000|20110127221318.000|TR0|for the Arts; massive cuts also for 
20110127221318.000|20110127221320.000|TR0|homeland security, the federal court

20110127222839.000|20110127222841.000|TR0|DEBORAH FEYERICK, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  
20110127222841.000|20110127222843.000|TR0|Well, Wolf, you know the rise of 
20110127222843.000|20110127222845.000|TR0|drug-resistant bacteria is taking on 
20110127222845.000|20110127222848.000|TR0|greater urgency.  Health officials fearing 
20110127222848.000|20110127222850.000|TR0|a lack of new antibiotics could set the 
20110127222850.000|20110127222852.000|TR0|scene for common infections to become a 
20110127222852.000|20110127222854.000|TR0|major cause of death around the world.
20110127222854.000|20110127222857.000|TR0|
20110127222857.000|20110127222859.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20110127222859.000|20110127222901.000|TR0|
20110127222901.000|20110127222904.000|TR0|FEYERICK (voice-over):  You're looking at 
20110127222904.000|20110127222906.000|TR0|bacteria that causes potentially deadly 
20110127222906.000|20110127222908.000|TR0|anthrax.  Now watch closely as scientists 
20110127222908.000|20110127222910.000|TR0|introduce a revolutionary new protein.  In 
20110127222910.000|20110127222913.000|TR0|a matter of seconds, the cells explode.
20110127222913.000|20110127222915.000|TR0|
20110127222915.000|20110127222917.000|TR0|PAUL JACKSON, LIVERMORE NATIONAL 
20110127222917.000|20110127222919.000|TR0|LABORATORY:  We were kind of surprised 
20110127222919.000|20110127222922.000|TR0|that it was so potent.
20110127222922.000|20110127222924.000|TR0|
20110127222924.000|20110127222926.000|TR0|FEYERICK:  For scientist Paul Jackson, 
20110127222926.000|20110127222929.000|TR0|what began as a biodefense project for the 
20110127222929.000|20110127222931.000|TR0|Pentagon could be the next promising tool 
20110127222931.000|20110127222933.000|TR0|in fighting drug-resistant bacteria or 
20110127222933.000|20110127222935.000|TR0|superbugs that can no longer be treated 
20110127222935.000|20110127222938.000|TR0|using existing antibiotics.
20110127222938.000|20110127222940.000|TR0|
20110127222940.000|20110127222942.000|TR0|JACKSON:  We're going in, finding the 
20110127222942.000|20110127222944.000|TR0|critical pathways and basically messing 
20110127222944.000|20110127222947.000|TR0|those pathways up so badly that it kills 
20110127222947.000|20110127222949.000|TR0|the cell.
20110127222949.000|20110127222951.000|TR0|
20110127222951.000|20110127222954.000|TR0|FEYERICK:  The technique was created by 
20110127222954.000|20110127222956.000|TR0|scientists at Lawrence Livermore National 
20110127222956.000|20110127222958.000|TR0|Lab, an hour's drive from San Francisco.  
20110127222958.000|20110127223000.000|TR0|Tested on anthrax bacteria, it could also 
20110127223000.000|20110127223003.000|TR0|work on infections caused by drug- 
20110127223003.000|20110127223005.000|TR0|resistant E. coli or MRSA, a type of staph 
20110127223005.000|20110127223007.000|TR0|bacteria resistant to many common 
20110127223007.000|20110127223010.000|TR0|antibiotics, often found in hospitals but 
20110127223010.000|20110127223012.000|TR0|also community settings like locker rooms, 
20110127223012.000|20110127223014.000|TR0|playing fields or schools.
20110127223014.000|20110127223016.000|TR0|
20110127223016.000|20110127223019.000|TR0|JACKSON:  We're using a protein that is 
20110127223019.000|20110127223021.000|TR0|part of the cell's own machinery, so it's 
20110127223021.000|20110127223023.000|TR0|hard to understand how it could become 
20110127223023.000|20110127223025.000|TR0|resistant to something that it needs.
20110127223025.000|20110127223028.000|TR0|
20110127223028.000|20110127223030.000|TR0|FEYERICK:  The idea is simple.  
20110127223030.000|20110127223032.000|TR0|Antibiotics fight against bacteria from 
20110127223032.000|20110127223035.000|TR0|the outside.  The new technique uses the 
20110127223035.000|20110127223037.000|TR0|bacteria's own genes to attack from within.
20110127223037.000|20110127223039.000|TR0|
20110127223039.000|20110127223041.000|TR0|(on camera):  The gene cannot defeat 
20110127223041.000|20110127223044.000|TR0|itself.  You're using the cell's own genes 
20110127223044.000|20110127223046.000|TR0|to attack it.
20110127223046.000|20110127223048.000|TR0|
20110127223048.000|20110127223050.000|TR0|JACKSON:  That's exactly right.  And the 
20110127223050.000|20110127223053.000|TR0|protein is made by the gene.
20110127223053.000|20110127223055.000|TR0|
20110127223055.000|20110127223057.000|TR0|FEYERICK:  Because there's no way to mount 
20110127223057.000|20110127223100.000|TR0|a defense against that.
20110127223100.000|20110127223102.000|TR0|
20110127223102.000|20110127223104.000|TR0|JACKSON:  It's hard to understand how it 
20110127223104.000|20110127223106.000|TR0|could become resistant to something that 
20110127223106.000|20110127223109.000|TR0|it needs.
20110127223109.000|20110127223111.000|TR0|
20110127223111.000|20110127223113.000|TR0|FEYERICK (voice-over):  Watch again as the 
20110127223113.000|20110127223115.000|TR0|genetic-based protein is added.  The cell 
20110127223115.000|20110127223118.000|TR0|wall holding everything together 
20110127223118.000|20110127223120.000|TR0|essentially rips apart.
20110127223120.000|20110127223122.000|TR0|
20110127223122.000|20110127223125.000|TR0|JACKSON:  You strip the outside wall off, 
20110127223125.000|20110127223127.000|TR0|and the cell can't survive without the 
20110127223127.000|20110127223129.000|TR0|wall.
20110127223129.000|20110127223131.000|TR0|
20110127223131.000|20110127223134.000|TR0|FEYERICK (voice-over):  And because 
20110127223134.000|20110127223136.000|TR0|multiple variations of the protein can be 
20110127223136.000|20110127223138.000|TR0|made at once, resistance is unlikely, says 
20110127223138.000|20110127223140.000|TR0|Jackson. Let's say in the event you get 
20110127223140.000|20110127223143.000|TR0|anthrax twice.
20110127223143.000|20110127223145.000|TR0|
20110127223145.000|20110127223147.000|TR0|(on camera):  So it gives you the ability 
20110127223147.000|20110127223150.000|TR0|in a very simple way to stay one step 
20110127223150.000|20110127223152.000|TR0|ahead of that which you're trying to 
20110127223152.000|20110127223154.000|TR0|defeat.
20110127223154.000|20110127223156.000|TR0|
20110127223156.000|20110127223159.000|TR0|JACKSON:  That's right.  But that's all 
20110127223159.000|20110127223201.000|TR0|you're ever going to do with bacteria.  I 
20110127223201.000|20110127223203.000|TR0|mean, one step ahead is good.
20110127223203.000|20110127223205.000|TR0|
20110127223205.000|20110127223208.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20110127223208.000|20110127223210.000|TR0|
20110127223210.000|20110127223212.000|TR0|FEYERICK:  Now, the technique is still 
20110127223212.000|20110127223215.000|TR0|experimental and has yet to be tested in 
20110127223215.000|20110127223217.000|TR0|humans.  The lab says that both the 
20110127223217.000|20110127223219.000|TR0|Centers for Disease Control and Department 
20110127223219.000|20110127223221.000|TR0|of Homeland Security are looking at 
20110127223221.000|20110127223224.000|TR0|samples.  This is envisioned as a topical
